title: Associate Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Maryland Institute College of Art
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed for a position in the Humanities division of the college. It consisted of a standard 1.5-day interview process, with a lecture followed by Q&A, individual meetings with staff members on campus (deans, faculty), and a lunch/interview where they used a standardized, 10-question template to ask about teaching and research.
Interview Questions: How to accommodate diversity in the classroom.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Maryland Institute College of Art
Interview Descriptions: there were multiple interviewers which felt nerve-wracking but they made you feel very welcome the whole time. They described the position well with what duties would be required. They made me feel comfortable and not as nervous going into it.

title: Front Desk Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Maryland Institute College of Art
Interview Descriptions: Great time everyone in the process was very nice. Just be calm and it’s basically a breeze. Remembering your resume is very much key to the process and stating your words clearly.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Maryland Institute College of Art
Interview Descriptions:
This process took much longer than was necessary. I was called by a Human Resources representative at the end of August after applying for the job several times over the last year (I graduated from art college and figured MICA would be a good fit for me since I also worked in several departments at my art college). I called back twice the day I was contacted and reached the person's voicemail. I left two messages and received no calls back that day. I then called twice the next day, leaving messages again. None of my calls were returned. 

A week later I received an email from the representative that seemed as if they didn't receive any of my calls at all. She told me she was hoping to schedule a quick 30-minute call. We did the call the following day. She asked pretty generic questions and when I asked about the job she couldn't tell me much about what it entailed (having worked in HR, I understand you won't know every detail about every job description, but you at least have a decent idea). 

Overall, the entire process seemed a bit disorganized. My phone interview was July 24th and I didn't receive anything back about the job until today, September 4th. I know a lot of jobs will either never get back to you or send a generic response if you didn't make the cut, but I didn't feel that this interview could even be considered as such.
Interview Questions: How did you hear about this job?

title: Department of Exhibitions Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Maryland Institute College of Art
Interview Descriptions:
I work there as a work study during the school year. I submitted my resume and cover letter.
Since it was a work study you didnt have to go in for a actual interview, as long as you are a good student who needs help.

title: International Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Maryland Institute College of Art (Baltimore, MD) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: I was called out of the blue by their HR Specialist due to a current employee resigning - had applied for another position that was completely different, months prior. The person calling was abrupt, unprofessional, and impatient during the entirety of the call. I was told I would be called back the following day to schedule an in-person interview and never was. When I emailed to follow up, this same HR Specialist was cold and unhelpful. Not happy with this kind of treatment.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your work experience.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Maryland Institute College of Art in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was a very easy process. The initial phone screening interview was not difficult. At the in-person interview, the directors and recruiter seemed genuinely interested in my skills and experiences as opposed to just asking questions back to back.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose to apply to this specific department?

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Maryland Institute College of Art (Baltimore, MD) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was great. The director is very personable. I come in, she greeted me, we sat down, we chat, I talk about my work, she explains about the office. It was good.

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Maryland Institute College of Art (Baltimore, MD) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions:
The interview was quite thorough.  The questions inquired about leadership, programming ability, scheduling ability, health and wellness knowledge (including mental health, and physical health), exercise knowledge, nutritional knowledge, and ability to read a calendar.  The interview was in a white room, with about 8 chairs.  There were only two people in the room though, so that was interesting.

Anyway, the staff was fairly nice to me during the interview, they were quite open about what they wanted in a candidate, and didn't waste any time.  They asked pointed questions and you could tell when you said an answer they liked.
Interview Questions: What kind of programs would you create for our less socially inclined community members?

title: Assistant Director of Student Activities Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Maryland Institute College of Art
Interview Descriptions:
Initial communication via telephone to set up skype interview.
Skype interview consisted of 4 of the office members, including the director and other assistant directors.  All members were very friendly during interview and very attentive.  It was very clear that some of the questions were based off information provided on resume and cover letter.
Interview Questions: Questions were asked in a "popcorn" style way, each person would ask a question after the other, an unexpected question was, Is there anything else about you that you can share, that is not listed on your resume.

title: Administrative Assistant Position In Graphic Design and Video Department Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Maryland Institute College of Art (Baltimore, MD) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: To me, it seemed like they already have someone internally like the most recent graduate student. Our interview was just a screening purposes. They weren't exactly looking into hire anyone.  After the interview session,  I knew, I wasn't going to get this job.
Interview Questions: How did you describe yourself in 5 years?
